sentences.en: By now the uproar outside was more furious than ever.
sentences.cn: 大门外的呼噪这时更加凶猛.

sentences.en: His remarks threw the audience into an uproar.
sentences.cn: 他的讲话使听众沸腾起来.

sentences.en: She could hear the uproar in the room.
sentences.cn: 她能听见房间里的吵闹声.

sentences.en: The announcement caused uproar in the crowd.
sentences.cn: 公告在人群中引起了骚动。

sentences.en: The audience burst into an uproar.
The courtroom was in an uproar.
The meeting ended in ( an ) uproar.
sentences.cn: 会议在一阵喧嚣中结束.

sentences.en: The paper says the evidence, when it surfaces, is certain to cause uproar.
sentences.cn: 该报称该证据一经披露，一定会引起骚动。

sentences.en: The rally began in an uproar.
sentences.cn: 大会在一片喧腾声中开始了.

sentences.en: The room was in an uproar.
The town is in uproar over the dispute.
sentences.cn: 整个城市因为这次争端而陷入了骚动。

sentences.en: The uproar in the cafe lasted long after midnight.
sentences.cn: 咖啡馆的喧闹一直持续到午夜之后很久.

sentences.en: The uproar was enough to rouse both the quick and the dead.
sentences.cn: 这喧嚣声足以惊醒生者和死者.

sentences.en: With the whole meeting in uproar, the chairman abandoned the attempt to take a vote.
sentences.cn: 因为整个会议一片喧嚣, 主持会议的人放弃了投票表决的尝试.

sentences.en: You are wanted immediately; we are all in an uproar.
sentences.cn: 你得马上出来一下; 我们已闹得天翻地覆了.

trans.tran_en: a lot of noise or angry protest about something
